Reviews.Title: “Like staying with family!”
Reviews.Author: big_yammysammy
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very comfortable, like staying at a relatives home. Kinda crumbing around the edges and no doubt you are in New Orleans! I want to feel the ambiance of a place! Staying in a hotel that could be ripped up and put in any city is not for me! If you're looking for a hotel that fits the cookie cutter look than this is not it! The elevator was old, scary and small, so we only used it to go up and used the stairs to come down.We felt very safe walking from Bourbon or Frenchman at night. Quiet area and good hot (free) coffee in the morning. Parking was a bit of a goat rope (you need a map), but its free and that's unusual in New Orleans. The neighborhood bakery across the street was an added bonus! Love the Quiche Loraine and the chocolate croissants! P.S. we have stayed twice here and plan to stay again in November. Just love this place!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this place--great location, price, vibe & service!”
Reviews.Author: LydiaGenevieve
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review since I stayed in July. This is what I wrote in my trip report about Villa Convento: I had room 302 and LOVED it! It's for a certain type of person though, I think--if you're excited by the sound of my husband's room at the Hilton in the Business District (cookie-cutter) then you might not love Hotel Villa Convento--it's very funky. My husband and I both adored it though, especially the exposed brick wall and the balcony facing Croissant D'Or across the street! There isn't anything but wrought iron separating the balcony from its neighbor so it doesn't really have much privacy, and the building across the street has a balcony, but I LOVED it out there and spent huge parts of the day out there, reading, eating, drinking, people-watching, even though it was REALLY hot! I love that you can see into the Beauregard-Keyes House garden across the street, which is supposedly haunted. The elevator is also super-funky (200 years old, floral-padded and only fits 2 people) and I loved it, but I did try to take the stairs for the most part! The inner courtyard is cute and the way some rooms open onto it reminds me of Armistead Maupin's Barbary Lane. The people who work the front desk are super accommodating and nice and we will most certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sgcmrg
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we did notice that the room smelled a little musty, but just assumed it was from being closed up. It got better the longer we stayed. Don't know if we just got use to it or what.There is free parking but the parking is about 6 to 8 blocks away. We did have a couple of issues while we were there. Both my son-in-law and my husband got locked in the bathroom and we couldn't get the door open. Got my son-in-law out within 10 minutes or so, but took two employees and 38 minutes for my husband to be freed. No central air only window units and our stopped working the last night we were there, but even with these issues I would stay here again. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cristionas
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was perfect- great location- and the staff is super friendly and helpful.Vince was very helpful with places to eat etc... If you're looking for a hotel with charm and charcter this is the place for you! We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a funky, old hotel with tons of character, wonderful service and a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: caryalexandraj
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that if you are looking for an "up to date" hotel with all the amenities, go somewhere else. If you like old places, appreciate character and don't mind a little patina and peeling paint this is the place for you. The rooms are all different and definitely clean although sometimes a little tired. The beds are very comfortable and the comforters were updated and clean as well. Some of the rooms have wonderful views and others open on to the courtyard, which is a nice place to relax when you just can't walk anymore. The hotel is far enough away from the action to be quiet, but an easy walk to everything important in the Quarter. The old elevator is an experience for sure, and sometimes has a mind of its own. Speaking of experiences, if you are lucky, one night you might get a visit from some of the spirits that benignly "haunt" the place. The staff are wonderful, especially Vince who is proud and happy to share the history of the place, and quick to recommend good places to eat or call you a cab. I love this wonderful old place and plan to stay on all my return trips to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Atljulie7
Reviews.Content: Vincenzo is the concierge extraordinaire!! Hotel is awesome in so many ways. If you are looking for something in the French Quarter walking distance from everything, this is your place!!! Xoxo Julie, Felicity & Wade

Reviews.Title: “Quirky charm in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Sand-Darwin
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are bit run down. "Grandma" the elevator reminds me of a padded cell and who knows if it will make it to your floor. Would I want it any other way? No. If you want fancy go somewhere else. Perhaps in some other city I may not be so pleased with this place but in New Orleans Villa Convento just seems to work. Vince, one of the front desk staff was so helpful and has a truly encyclopedic knowledge of the city and excellent taste in terms of recomending places to visit and eat. An added plus is a great breakfast place right across the street. Its location makes it quiet at night too. If you are looking for a well priced, convenient place and can forgive the slighty run down aspects of the place, I strongly suggest giving this hotel a try. I'm only sorry my room wasnt haunted. I cant wait to come back to this amazing city and another stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 123noway
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately it was NOT what some reviews said. To start off the location is great but not the hotel itself. The rooms are very beaten up, the air conditioner unit is very noisy, there is great humidity which leads to mold, which is visible in bedroom and the bathroom walls, and not to even mention the smell of the room was just unbearable. The closet hangers are embarrassing- old abused-wire dry cleaning hangers, the door handle was broken. Every time we opened the door the handle would fall on our feet. I did let the front desk know, but there was nothing they could do about it, and no offer of any option to reacommodate us or look for a solution.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly Staff - Old & Tired with Great Character”
Reviews.Author: redrockrooster
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 nights and had a good time. Sure the building is old, furniture tired, and the hotel could certainly use some upkeep, but this is not the Hilton and our stay was pleasant. The room was clean, the staff friendly, and the location was perfect. If you want to experience old style, historic New Orleans at a fair and reasonable price, Hotel Villa Convento is a place to consider. If you are picky and looking for an up to date, modern room, with fancy fixing, just book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential New Orleans Charm and the Best Staff in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Soulcat
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Villa Convento. We had booked room 302 for nine days, but then added a tenth day at the front. 302 wasn't available, but they were able to give us Room 301 for the first night, which wasn't a balcony room, but it did have the most charming canopy bed and a separate day bed. For the remainder of our stay, Room 302 was a perfect fit with a wonderful view. We could even see the tops of ships as they went down the Mississippi (the sea wall kept part of the view obscured) We also view many carriages going by in front of the hotel as well as a second line parade and the filming of a commercial. The bed was very comfortable which made it very easy to sleep. Even if you don't get a balcony room at the Villa Convento, there are plenty of outdoor stairways and balconies where you can take great pictures or just get some excellent views. As on my first visit, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Vince was ever smiling and happy to tell us about area attractions and life in the French Quarter. Warren clued us in on some great spots in the nearby Marigny and Bywater, and Barbara was the most vibrant person I've ever encountered at a front desk. They all did so much to make our stay relaxing and enjoyable, and "Grandma" the very old, very unique elevator certainly adds to the charm of the Villa Convento.

Reviews.Title: “The Convento was Haunted!”
Reviews.Author: breathleslie
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay at Hotel Villa Convento- it was "quaint" (as my mother would say). Quaint translated to "run down" upon inspection. The place does have a rustic charm if you can overlook tattered linens, mold in the bathroom and a stain that looked suspiciously like blood on the side of the tub. The sink was in the exceptionally small bedroom, btw. There are some bright spots,though; a location that makes it easy to visit many of the more popular tourist destinations by foot, and a nice and helpful staff. We wish someone on staff would've warned my husband that he might wake up in the middle of the night to some bizarre apparition standing in the corner glaring at him, though! When we talked to the lady at the desk about his experience the next morning, she just shrugged and said "this place just isn't right." This phantom certainly spooked my otherwise unflappable husband. With even a little renovation and TLC, this could be a very charming place. Of course, then they'd probably raise the very reasonable room rates. Luckily, we didn't have to pay extra for the ghost.

Reviews.Title: “Found my spot in the French Quarter...”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy L
Reviews.Content: Wife and I fully enjoyed our stay at Villa Convento for our honeymoon in April. We had no desire to stay at the typical hotel that's perfect to a fault: no charm, no character, all cookie-cutter. You don't get that with Villa Convento. Granted, we stayed in a suite, but if the other rooms are anything like that one, I can't imagine I'd think any differently about the place. The bed was comfortable, the porch/balcony was relatively secluded with a great view of New Orleans proper, and the courtyard had a pleasant European charm. The staff was extremely courteous. We got there and the room wasn't ready yet, so Warren had a locked closet to stash our luggage while we grabbed lunch at the French Market, which was well within walking distance. Speaking of distance, its proximity to Frenchman Street (where we spent our evenings hopping jazz clubs) was close enough that it didn't feel as if we were walking miles to and from our room. If I had to critique anything, one big one is that you're not allowed to adjust the temperature of the a/c. In July and August that probably wouldn't be an issue, but April isn't so hot that we need constant air conditioning. Having only one trash can was also a bit vexing, since we would bring food back to the hotel to eat later and would leave our take-out boxes half hanging out of the tiny trash can. We were also under the impression that a whirlpool bath was included in the suite, which it wasn't, but perhaps we read the website wrong. All in all, we very much enjoyed our stay and would happily lodge here again, as well as recommend it to friends looking for a true New Orleans experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: ksloan1252
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. The staff was very attentive, and happy to accomodate our requests. If you are looking for a traditional hotel, this isn't for you. If you want a true New Orleans experience, this is definitely the place. You can find a Westin or Marriott anywhere, but this is unique. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Joann00
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying at a quaint family run hotel but we couldn't have been more disappointed. My friend arrived the day before I did and was offered room 104 off of the courtyard, instead of the 2nd floor room that we were originally suppose to stay in. Since this seemed reasonable, she agreed. What a disaster!! It started when entering the room and having the room door handle fall off in her hand...it went downhill from there. The smell of the room was awful. She was told that this was an old building and she may not be "used" to the musty smell. "Musty" doesn't even come close to describing it. After trying to put up with the smell and finding that it was almost unbearable, she requested a change in rooms - but was told they were booked full and we couldn't be moved. The entire place needs to have a deep cleaning. There was black mold very visible in the bathroom corners/ceiling and on the bath mat. Moths were flying around in the room. We could have put up with the holes in the walls and the worn furniture but the lack of cleanliness was appalling. We didn't unpack anything as we didn't want the smell and anything else invading our clothing. Our belongings still picked up the odor of the room and it was very noticeable when we moved to a new hotel. The room was so dim, even with every light turned on, that you couldn't read a book. Parking is free but make sure that you realize it is 5 blocks away. Thank goodness we were able to find another hotel. A positive - they didn't hold us to their 72 hr cancellation requirement but we did give them a 24 hr notice as we couldn't immediately get into another hotel. While it was in a convenient location, there are certainly more options available. I would never consider going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: PMMIllinois
Reviews.Content: My first stay in this little gem. Yes there are some very simple things that can be done to update and give this little hotel an excellent rating but not matter, I would stay here again in a heartbeat! If you are looking for the big chain type hotels this is not the place for you. We wanted something very New Orleans and I believe we got just that. Perfect location right in the French Quarter, quiet and within walking distance to everything we wanted to do and experience while in New Orleans, Jackson Square, the Basilica, Cafe Du Monde, old cemeteries, street car, great old homes, food, drink, and music. And I can not say enough about the staff we met, a young fellow, and two very nice young ladies, very accommodating and patient with us tourists. I never did get to meet Warren who I believe is one of the original family owners but he too was very helpful over the phone prior to our visit. Definitely would go back to New Orleans and if in the French Quarter would stay in this little gem again.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love, this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: poolejkp17
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the years, but my most recent visit 2 weeks ago I will always remember. After driving 5 hours from Shreveport, I arrived to check in and my wallet was missing! We had to drive back to Breaux Bridge to get it-and that was after I cancelled our credit cards. My bank was to send me a new one directly to the hotel. That adorable Warren let us check in without a credit card and stay 2 nights until our package arrived. I always ask for a balcony room, and we got a good parking place right in front of Croissant d'or just across the street. The elevator is my favorite part-please don't ever change it. Loved our room, the coffee each morning in the lobby, sitting out on our balcony-does life get any better than this? On Sunday morning while sitting out on our balcony, we heard a brass band playing "Just a closer walk with thee". I ran down to see it and they were filming a jazz funeral! What fun to watch! Many thanks to Warren, Vince, and that cute Barbara with her new rose tatoo-I love all of you!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JHester
Reviews.Content: I love this place we stayed there last year for Easter and did the same this year. If you love old New Orleans then you will love this, we had room 300 which is a balcony room even though it was small who cares the bed was great and part of the walls was the original brick. It is only 2 blocks from Bourbon but you wouldn't know it. Barbara and Warren are great they make you feel like part of the family. If you want 5 star hotel this isn't it if you want to stay in a part of New Orleans history then this is the place and yes it is suppose to be haunted so if you hear a knock at your door its the madam from when it was a bordello looking for new customers!

Reviews.Title: “Poor and Overpriced Hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jjmeador
Reviews.Content: It was New Year's Day, and friends were staying here. I was driving in for the night, and they were able to get me a room. The staff was accomodating for me on only staying one night (they had a two-night minimum usually). But the room - which opened into a courtyard - was just above awful. Old, been a long time since anything had been done. Bathroom was really bad. Given the holiday, I was awakened by drunks at 3 A.M. in the courtyard. In the morning, our group met in the small reception area - only to find two staff members having a loud argument, and they didn't care if guests heard what was going on. The room was way overpriced, but it was the French Quarter and a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “best bed i have ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: nursetnt
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant of staying here, reserving at the last minute for St. Patrick's Day weekend. When i arrived i was surprised to see how many "foo-foo uppity rich women" (as my husband put it) demanding the woman at the front desk's attention. As my husband reasoned "if they are staying here, then it cant be that bad". She (who by the way was terribly sick from the flu and took all of her strength not to throw up) was extremely polite and pleasant and accommodated all of their needs in stride. Upon my turn, she not only allowed us to check in early, but felt bad about us waiting and gave us a nicer room than we had reserved. I knew when we checked it that this was a building built in the early 1800s. I knew that the rooms would be smaller and not have all the fancy amenities that the crown plaza would have. I booked this for the old world charm and the convience of being smack dab in the middle of the french quarter. It turned out that my husband and i both had the flu the entire stay and spent a large amount of time in the bed. It was the most comfortable mattress i had ever slept on. in fact, when we arrived back home, i wound up calling the hotel to find out the brand name and purchasing the same mattress several weeks later (we stayed in room 303 in the main building). The air condition cooled the room very quickly (a plus to a smaller room) and i didn't hear any of the neighbors, but enjoyed jazz music floating through our open window. I also thoroughly enjoyed how close it was to the french market and proceeded to take the trolley the entire time and didn't touch the car once (which i was able to park in a secure, locked building free of charge by the hotel). This place was fabulous and the staff there were even better. the night guy was an absolute pleasure to talk with about the ghost stories and history of the place. the elevator on the other hand was very scary, but i took the stairs instead. I am already planning on taking the kids their in august

Reviews.Title: “Charming place to rest your head!”
Reviews.Author: Heidihoe85
Reviews.Content: When staying the French Quarter, you have to keep in mind that modern amenities are not always at your disposal. Sometimes it's nice to step away from every day life and immerse yourself in all that New Orleans has to offer. Hotel Villa Convento is just the place to rest your head after that awesome day of taking in all that the city has to offer! I came across this hotel by pure accident and I have never had a single regret! This charming hotel in the middle of the French Quarter is my home away from home when I'm in New Orleans. It's set on the quieter side of the Quarter, a block from the French Market and has the most wonderful, helpful staff I've ever come across in my travels. Price is exceptionally reasonable compared to what you will find anywhere close to this location. We often book the loft rooms that can sleep up to 6 but I've stayed in the single rooms which are quaint and lovely for that romantic weekend! I highly recommend Room 207 or any of the balcony rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy but needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: wildchough
Reviews.Content: Great off-Bourbon St location so sleep a good possibility until the early morning garbage trucks, a scourge of the French Quarter. Well-located across the street from a very good and beautiful bakery or one block from a Community Coffee store. Avoid the elevator which is ancient if you can or send up the luggage separately. Some of the rooms are well-situated with balconies overlooking Ursuline Street but don't lean against the faux metal railings as the wood has serious rot. The rooms are small and contain the basics. I found the bathrooms adequate, the rooms a bit dreary with brick walls and the bed linens rather in need of replacement. There's a nice enclosed place to park your car for free a few blocks away and you're not going to find anything cheaper that's bearable in the The Quarter. Staff is good and helpful. We had two rooms and one had mold in the non-fanned bathroom and the other I considered reasonably clean. The rooms are small but who stays in their room much in the Quarter? Depending upon the room you may have a fairly good stay or one that you may want to only spend one night.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic”
Reviews.Author: Wineteacher
Reviews.Content: Old fashion "charm" Zero amenities Old furniture Minimal decor High tolerance for dirty Nice people Great location Historic building

Reviews.Title: “Quaint in an excellent location, but needs a few improvements.”
Reviews.Author: Aroldill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in mid March. The location is great. The pastry shop across the street is very convenient. We enjoyed coffee overlooking the street in the morning. On the down side was the cleanliness of the room as well as the old bedding, specifically the sheets and blanket. They were old and scratchy Our room smelled of mold. Towels never dried. The elevator is very unique. I would stay here again, but hope the management steps up their expectations of their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Rustic & New Orleans Charm”
Reviews.Author: cajunyank
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights this past weekend at the Hotel Villa Convento on Ursuline Street. The location is mid point between the Marigny section and Jackson Square and also close to the French Market. Our room overlooked a small but very nice courtyard and had the feel of an old creole home. We had one wall that was old time brick and we had a large four poster bed. And the elevator that slighly resembles a padded telephone booth should be a tourist attraction. The entire staff here treats you like a long lost, and liked, relative that has come home for a visit. They are so helpful and accommodating and this family aspect is what others have said and attracted us to see what this place was like. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, stinky with little upkeep, but great location”
Reviews.Author: SaraPA
Reviews.Content: I confidently book our hotel room months in advance after reading the many popular reviews on TripAdvisor. We are pretty low key and don't mind "quaint" or even a little run-down. But this place was down right nasty. We were in room 201, a balcony room. When we first opened the door, I immediately smelled "pee" and my friend smelled "bachelor flop house." The smelled didn't improve even after leaving the balcony door open for a while. We ended up buying incense to sort of cover up the sour smell. It rained that day, while we were away. Upon returning to the room, I stepped onto wet carpet that literally soaked through my sock. It wasn't a small area, pretty much the majority of the area between the bed and the balcony door. (That explained the sour wet smell.) When I mentioned it to the front desk, I was told: "Huh. I thought they fixed that. Sorry." Seriously, that was it. The floor was damp for the full 3 days and 2 nights we were in the room. Then we started actually looking around the room. Holes in the wall. A nail hole filled in with something blue--toothpaste? Water stains on the ceiling and wall. Dust that had turned into dirt in most corners. Even the cord for the hairdryer was gross and dirty. The bathtub didn't drain, so you had to take a shower standing in dirty water standing up to mid-shin. (Sadly, I always seemed to get the second shower, so two people's dirty water up to mid-shin). On a positive note, the location was great. Able to walk everywhere, and much less noisy than mid French Quarter. The front desk, while not really caring about the state of the room, were very pleasant and otherwise helpful. The balconies are *great*. Perfect way to start your morning is to walk over to Croissant D'or and wake up with coffee and a pastry. Be forewarned, however, that the balconies are *awful* when your drunk neighbor comes home and talks loudly on the next balcony at 3AM) In closing, if you don't mind stinky, dirty rooms but crave a great location, this is the place for you. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DeanAcres
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights in March of 2011. We stayed for a week! We stayed in three different rooms during our 7 nights in New Orleanes. All of the rooms were clean and quiet. The staff was very helpful and friendly. If you cant look past the little imperfections stay at a Hilton or Hyatt. A great view from the fourth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, full of history and ambiance; top location and great value”
Reviews.Author: tropicgirl39
Reviews.Content: This hotel is delightful. For those who do not know - this hotel is a former brothel - the brothel upon which the Animal's song "House of the Rising Sun" is based. The location cannot be beaten - right in the French Quarter, a few blocks from all the action on Bourbon Street. We also felt perfectly safe wandering around late at night especially after club hopping and dancing for hours at the various clubs in Bourbon Street. There is a also a great little patisserie across the street. The rooms are rustic and full of ambiance. Our room was on the ground floor overlooking the courtyard. This place was also unbeatable value. We had a ball in New Orleans. We can't wait to go back. When we do, we'll definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Less touristy/hipper part of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Justyna B
Reviews.Content: We arrived for the first weekend of the Carnivale season(2/3/12). We were excited to see the first parade of the season the Krewe du Vieaux (Saturday 2/4/12). I had no idea when I booked the hotel tha the last leg of the parade route goes right now Ursiline and our balcony (Room 201) gave us a great view of the whole thing. We loved the less touristy location because we love music and all the really fantastic jazz venues are within 2-6 blocks either along Decatur and a little further north east along Frenchmen street in neighboring Marigny neighborhood (BMC, Blue Nile the Spotted Cat, D.B.A etc). Admittedly the hotel is on the older side. Our room was the middle balcony room on the 2nd floor and had carpeting and smelled a little musty. The neighboring balcony rooms both have hard wood floors I believe and didn't smell musty at all. For the price compared to other French Quarter hotels and for the location I can't say anything bad about this place. Across the street you have the famous D'Or Bakery which has what I think are the best chocolate croissants in the US. The only reason I'm giving this place 4 stars instead of 5 is due to the parking situation which requires toting a key back and forth to get your car out. Would be great if they would upgrade the garage door to work with the hotel keys or some other type of code. There was actually plenty of street parking right on Ursulines Street so we only had to use the garage 1 night to clear the street for the parade route. Overall fanstastic experience and kudos to the staff for being super friendly even though they deal with drunk tourists all day.

Reviews.Title: “james tedder loves this hotel”
Reviews.Author: james t
Reviews.Content: this is the best hotel in the french quarter trust me i have stayed in the hotel over 50 times my wife and i just got home from the bcs football game and we loved it this time more than ever warren we love you see you next stay

Reviews.Title: “HOSPITABLE”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan37
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weeks stay at the HVC. I stayed in room #303 in the main building. The room was very quiet with very little noise. This is what I requested upon booking and Warren made that happen. The room was very comfortable and had everything that I wanted. This hotel is in the absolute perfect location for visiting NOLA. Everything is right there and within a short very enjoyable walk. This hotel is located steps away from some of the top rated hotels/restraunts on TA. Thanks to all the very helpful friendly staff who work at the HVC. I truly felt like I was visiting family and that I had made it home (thank you Lane.) I will be returning to NOLA and this is where I will be staying. Now for some constructive feedback on what I feel could improve at the HVC and for me to give this property an excellent rating. My only complaint would be the cleanliness/upkeep. Dirty carpet, dusty walls & moldings, stained mattress, burned out lighbulbs, and hair dryer that didn't work. Not complaining and didn't impact my enjoyment in staying here. But could be a problem for others that would like to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “First rate concierge, comfortable and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: I just returned from five nights at the Villa Convento. Let me state at the outset that the concierge, Lane Guidry, made this stay utterly perfect. His pleasant manner and his willingnes to do whatever asked was delightful. He made sure I had cabs quickly, and I overheard him arranging the delivery of a rental car for another guest. The night concierge, Mary, is also personable and willing to stay past her scheduled departure to help a guest. The location is on Ursuline, between Royal & Chartres. It is five blocks from the Frenchman Street area, about two blocks to the French Market, and two blocks to Bourbon. While a very convenient location, it is also a very QUIET location. Also, I never once felt fearful walking alone at night after parking my car. It also has the delightful happenstance of being directly across the street from Croissant d'Or, which is a lovely bakery that serves breakfast and lunch as well. There is an ATM there as well. The rooms were clean and comfortable. My first two nights were in a single room, which was basic, clean, and just what I needed. The remaining nights were in a room with two queen beds, sharing with a friend. Huge bathroom with a very deep tub, plenty of hot water, good water pressure, and soft, fluffy towels. The beds were comfortable and nicely appointed. This is not a luxury hotel, it is a guest house. It is a wonderful place to stay that isn't overpriced or in the middle of the drunken noisy action. I will return here and recommend it without a moment's hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in the main house”
Reviews.Author: KathyIpswich_MA
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews AFTER my husband booked this hotel, so I approached our stay with a little trepidation....... I was delighted to find that the hotel, while old and undergoing renovations, was very charming. Our room was in the very front of the building, on Ursulines--a fourth floor suite--large queen room with a large bathroom with jacuzzi tub and shower, and another room with a lovely iron daybed, with balconies on two sides--brilliant and gorgeous at daybreak, sunset, or anytime, really, and we could see the boats on the Mississippi River. This room overlooks the beautiful Ursuline convent grounds, and is steps away from the French Market. There is an amazing French pastry shop directly across the street. (The shop is only open until 2 pm, so get there early.--Choc., almond or ham and cheese croissants and wonderful coffee--yum!) Some of the reviews of Hotel Villa Convento complained of poor customer service, but we found that the front desk people (four over our two-day stay) couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. There is a little courtyard in the back and the rooms back there could be the ones that people had negative feedback on--I couldn't say. Parking is a few short blocks away, but it's FREE--which is unheard of in NOLA. It's within easy walking distance of Bourbon street and all other French Quarter fun. Staying here was like staying in a European hotel in any old European city. All in all, I very much recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Old Hotel With Very Classy Staff and Owners”
Reviews.Author: Soulcat
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for luxury, the latest tech advancements or a cookie cutter look, don't stay here. If you like the idea of a hotel with a history, rooms with character and a very helpful staff, the Villa Convento could be your hotel. We stayed in room 202 which had a great balcony facing Ursulines St and absolutely great water pressure in the shower and toilet. Let's face it, no one wants to stay in a room with a weak shower or a toilet that half flushes and the ones in 202 worked great. The bed was also very comfortable. During our stay we had a situation with the elevator and the staff/management of the hotel was very kind in giving us compensation without our having to ask for it. I would definitely stay here again. There is even a wonderful patisserie across the street. The hotel also offers free limited parking at a garage a few blocks away. Just remember the parking is first come, first served as people arrive at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I always check the Villa Convento first.”
Reviews.Author: pcurtin0
Reviews.Content: This little family owned hotel is one of my favorites in N.O. The location can't be beat and I love the balcony rooms in particular. Staff is always friendly. It's not your cookie-cutter, no character, no age sort of place like a high end chain hotel, but it's comfy and has a lot of charm and character. I even love the funky elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: SimplyPlaid
Reviews.Content: Being my first trip to New Orleans, I scoured the internet looking for the best place to stay. I am so happy that I found the Villa Convento. A historic creole townhouse nestled in the French Quarter, it has the abiance of stepping back in time. The courtyard is perfect to sit and have your morning coffee or just relax after a day of walking. The rooms are not generic hotel rooms, everyone is different and are very comfortable , some with balconies and some right in the courtyard. The greatest asset to our stay was the staff. Warren , Mary and Vince were great! They were very informative about the history of the area, the restuarants and the tours the city offered. If you want the Ritz, this isn't it..........it's better by far!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Again, had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, I really do. It has such a great feel of old New Orleans. Stayed in a 3rd floor blacony room again. Yes the room isn't the Ritz but that's not what I want when I come to NOLA. I want a personal feel. The elevator is classic and the hallways just take you back a hundred years. Love it. Those that give it poor reviews I think are accustomed to more expensive hotels. Enjoy the great deals here and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hobbitrosie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Villa Convento for three days recently. We absolutely loved it!!!! The service is great. The room was huge! Hotel Villa Convento has unbeatable charm and history, and is in the center of everything that is the French Quarter. We plan on staying there again! So charming that we relaxed and didn't worry about things like the internet. We would highly recommend a stay here to anyone visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3dsmom
Reviews.Content: After calling around trying to find a room for this past weekend, this hotel was recommended to us by a bed and breakfast we called to inquire on rooms. We really liked this hotel. Staff was wonderful! April was so nice and very helpful. We got a room with a balcony and loved sitting out there in the morning to drink our coffee. Room was clean. Just like the other reviews, this is an old New Orleans hotel and does not have all the bells and whistles of a 4 star hotel. We like finding these types of places to stay. Also, the beds are firm but we like sleeping on firm beds.

Reviews.Title: “Quality of hotel has diminished”
Reviews.Author: julsnj
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for about 10 years for Jazzfest. It is family owned and used to be like a home away from home. Now, the younger generation in the family is running it and it feels like they do not care about comfort of guests. Last year, I woke up during the night to find water pouring from the ceiling in the bathroom. For 2 days, I had to use the bathroom in the lobby before they fixed it. They had known about it prior because there was duct tape on the ceiling where the leak was! They didn't compensate me in any way. This year, when I arrived, the room smelled very musty! The duct tape is still on the ceiling! There is mold and water marks on the ceiling and walls (pictures attached). The shower does not work properly so that several inches of water accumulates in the tub. The toilet bowl handle has been broken for the past 4 years! If you don't push it carefully it falls off and you must open the tank and reassemble it. Meanwhile, at 9:15am, I was woken up by hammering and sawing outside our door. They were building a new room where the office had been. This happened several of the days, but in 4 years, they could not replace the toilet bowl handle in room 105! When I complained about them waking me up and about the condition of my room. Warren, the family member who now runs the hotel shrugged. I let him know I was disappointed and would not stay there again. After being a customer a few times a year, for 10 years he shrugged again and said "Alright".

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: jc111271
Reviews.Content: This was by far our favorite hotel stay ever. The staff is awesome, the location is perfect and if you are looking for a quirky New Orleans hotel then this is the one for you! The staff is wonderful. Warren had the greatest ideas when it came to sending us out into the night. It's close to everything if you want to walk, but if not just ask the front desk to call you a cab, and it's there in about 5 minutes. This is not a cookie cutter hotel, so if that kind of atmosphere is what you want then this would not be for you, but if you're looking for a great place to rest your head after a long day in the Big Easy, that has as much character as the city itself then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “One night in historic, funky old building was nice. We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Parrotheads
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night (thurs) before Mardi Gras (~$130w tax). Hotel Villa Convento was half the price of the Cornstalk Fence Hotel where we already had 5 nights reservation for the rest of Mardi Gras. Almost no room anywhere is worth the price you pay at Mardi Gras, but that itself is the price you pay for going to Mardi Gras. We arrived about 10:30 pm and were greeted by friendly desk clerk who gave us the all the basic information. Our room was a Queen Courtyard room. The interior of the building was very cool (if you like old and historic). Understand we have spent nearly 40 nights in 13-14 years coming to New Orleans annually and have stayed at many places. There was hot tea and coffee available in the cute little lobby which faced the street with windows open and was a very cozy seating area. Down the hall to find our room we passed an information board where they changed out the daily weather and happenings for guests to see. Out into the small but quaint courtyard we found a fountain and plants and a few tables with chairs. There appeared to an ice machine there too but we didn't use it. Our room had wood floors (very cool), a nice bed, brick interior walls. The ceiling fan was a great asset. Individual cooled room with fan option provided maximum comfort and background noise though we never heard any other room noise. We got several orbs in our photos from the first five minutes in the room but experienced nothing else ghostly during our 1 night. The sink is in the room with a separate room with shower and toilet. Plus: Location is excellent. Ceiling fan. Individual controlled air and fan (I'm a light sleeper and the background noise was great). Building and rooms are funky historic. Being parrotheads we loved that Jimmy Buffett had reportedly lived there in an apt. Rooms were clean and didn't smell smokey although there was a slight musty smell (but yeah you have to remember old, historic building in a damp city). Flat panel tv on the wall. Minus: Not much closet space (a rack in the corner of the room), but we didn't require any. Paint job looks like it was done by a six year old. Really, attention to detail with paint and maintenance was lacking in our room. The biggest minus as previous reviewers alluded to was that we woke in the a.m. to a smoker sitting 4 feet from our door puffing away. We couldn't open our door without letting the smoke inside. Nasty. Would be better to make the small courtyard nonsmoking too because the smoke hangs there in the courtyard. The Hotel Monteleone this is not, but that was not what we were looking for. As we told the clerk upon check-out, this is our kind of funky place and she said summer rates were really cheap (maybe half price), as we indicated we might be back in July. We mentioned above we spent the next 5 nights at the Cornstalk Fence Hotel, but we'd come back to the Hotel Villa Convento before we stayed there again. We'll stay most any place in the Quarter once. I don't know how the interior or second floor rooms would be so we'd probably request a courtyard queen again. If you are a picky, pampered, foofoo type then this is probably not the lodging for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff & full of character”
Reviews.Author: lzcobb
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel! We stayed over the weekend during the Mardi Gras season and had a wonderful time. The hotel was close to everything and very convenient for exploring the town during the day, slipping in for a quick nap and then going back out on the town all night. The staff was wonderful and always had great suggestions for new places to try - be sure to check out the bakery across the street. The secure parking was indispensable. We will absolutely be staying here again. Thanks everyone at the Hotel Villa Convento for a wonderful weekend (even to Tamale and especially to Oyster the resident pups)!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming with some needed TLC”
Reviews.Author: orock25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the NYE weekend and had a great time. The rate was very reasonable considering the time of year. The hotel has lots of charm and the staff is very friendly. The location is fantastic. In my view the parking is a plus. It's free, although a little bit of a walk, but parking in the French Quarter is a challenge so having a designated parking spot is huge. If you don't plan on driving during your stay, and I don't see why you would, it's well worth it. The hotel does have lots of charm that youâ€™re not going to get from staying in a chain hotel, however, that doesn't mean it doesn't need some TLC as other have mentioned in their reviews. but that wouldn't keep us from coming back. Especially if rates stay as reasonable as they are now.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but problems in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveller186338
Reviews.Content: Hotel Villa Convento is charming. However, we stayed there over the New Years period and were paying $330 per room per night. Ok that's a busy time in the French Quarter, and the location is excellent. But when you see what you get for that price...rooms with large holes in the walls, bricks walls that haven't been treated properly so that you're covered in red brick sediment it seems incredibly overpriced. On New Years Eve, there was a group of people who sat in the communal garden until 7am keeping the whole hotel awake. When we spoke with the receptionist about it, she said they had had the same problem with this group the previous year!? And yet did nothing from preventing it this year? I would say on a positive note that the staff were very friendly and helpful. But this place needs a major upgrade if it expects anyone to not feel ripped off at these types of prices. At $100 per night I would have said good deal. But be warned, things really are falling apart. Other things to be aware of is that the hotel falsely advertises that you will have a nice breakfast everyday in fliers and quite obviously online with photos, etc. This is 100% not true. There's coffee in a thermos at reception and of course a lovely cafe across the street where you pay for your own. Parking was a fiasco. Rather than investing in a key card system as you find at the hotel itself, you have this huge hassle of collecting the key from reception, walking to the garage (10 minutes) and then returning the key to reception, which means going through the one-way system and traffic. The key and lock were also not working properly, so it was the norm to stand trying to open the garage door for up to 10 minutes! All in all a place with promise, but at the moment way too shabby for the prices they charge at peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Chic with a dash a shabby”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddiction101
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean but a bit outdated and leave something to be desired in linens and drapes. However, the service is great and so is the location. Certainly worth the price. Located close to all the excitement but far enough away to have a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: stepgonz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the villa convento september 9-13th. It was my first trip to new orleans and wanted to stay at a more boutique hotel rather that a typical chain hotel. Upon arriving I immediately felt so comfortable at the hotel. The front desk is so nice and helpful. It is a great location just a few blocks from the bars on bourbon street. It is only about a block away from what soon became my favorite bar lafittes bar. It is on a quiet street so you can still get a good nights sleep. Of course since it has been around since the 1830's don't expect a super clean room. That is the only complaint I have, I wish it would have been a little more clean and the pillows smelled old and like mildew. Other that than you can't beat the price, location, or the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy with rustic charm and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: kaine16
Reviews.Content: Great location, enough to get a great nights sleep without all the hussle and bustle of Bourban St. Check out Frenchman St for great live music and restaurants. Super friendly and helpful staff, they were happy to answer all our questions. The hotel has loads of character and charm without all the over the top frills. Great recommendations would stay there again, be sure to also do the 'Treme' walking tour, which has great insight into the historical neighbourhood that gave birth to jazz and other significant cultural movements.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE BEST HOTEL EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: lady_gigi_frost
Reviews.Content: Hello My name is Lady Gigi, Myself and a girl friend had a girlâ€™s vacation to New Orleans. We stayed at the Hotel Villa Convento. Its family ran only, which is great and we got a great price. I have read several reviews and some not good. Let me tell you what it does not have, it more than makes up for it in the friendly family staff, location, itâ€™s cozy quarters and no matter what room you get your sure to have a beautiful time. I chose this hotel for many reasons: about 8 years ago my now ex-husband and I stayed there over night while I was on tour. It was fantastic and I feel in love with it straight away. The other reason is Iâ€™m a parapsychologist and this hotel is very active. We stayed in room 300 â€“ which a female and male ghost tend to roam. The bed shook, had my foot crabbed, was told to get out â€“ but not like get out!!! He wanted me up out of bed because it was 8:30am and I felt like sleeping in. I had my foot tickled one night and I heard the most beautiful music from an old Victrola play which had soft violins. I even saw a female ghost in the apartment across from the balcony at 1am one night. I did have a heard time sleeping because of the activate, but Iâ€™m very sensitive to these things and thatâ€™s what I went there for an got it. Even the smell of perfume, which neither me nor my friend wore because all the humidity during the day and night (itâ€™s pointless). The ladies of the House of the Rising Sun never sleep and are still working. We had a balcony which we took advantage of every day and night. The room was freezing even thought the ac was set on 72 my gage said it was 52 near the bed but 72 at the ac. We bought the owner a bottle of wine and meet another guest who was there on business. We drank wine in the lobby with them and had a fantastic time. Because the owner is local he told us about all the great local restaurants to eat at. We found this place called the Green Goddess it was one of my very favorites. There chief buys the freshest foods and the menu chances every two weeks. It was so much fun!!! I PROMISE youâ€™ll be happy you stayed at the Hotel Villa Convento and tell them Lady Gigi Frost sent you!!! We had clean sheets and pillow cases everyday, a freshly made bed, clean towels, soap everything we needed. THE BED WAS LIKE SLEEPING ON AIR - SO COMFORTABLE!!!With this said itâ€™s not the W or some swanky hotel, but itâ€™s got caricature, charm, itâ€™s quite (minus the ghosts), it has serious history and it is the only place I will ever stay when I visit N.Oâ€¦I CANT WAIT TO GO BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Unique Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: memphisbelle84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the far end of the French Quarter on Ursulines. Because of this, it is a lot quieter than hotels further up towards Bourbon. That being said, it's only two short blocks to the French Market and to Bourbon. The rate was exceptional for the location and although it didn't include onsite parking, it did include parking in their private garage which is located about 4 or 5 (short) blocks away. We were able to walk everywhere in the French Quarter easily and even took the St. Charles street car up to do some shopping on Magazine Street. We stayed in a room overlooking the courtyard that had 2 queen beds. It was plenty of room for three people. The decoration was simple and homey (there was a picture of the owner's dog on the dresser). We were able to use the courtyard whenever we liked to enjoy our breakfast or an Abita Amber (quietly of course!! This is not a party hotel). As many of the reviews have pointed out, this isn't a Holiday Inn and it doesn't prentend to be. If you are looking for the sterile, well appointed nature of a chain hotel, this isn't for you. If you can overlook some small things (slightly peeling wallpaper, a scary looking elevator, etc.) and laissez les bon temps roulez, this will be the perfect spot for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amyeliza7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with my husband and was very pleased with the hotel. The location is the best!! Everything in the French Quarter is within walking distance, but the street is quite enough for a restful sleep. Our room had a balcony and would highly recommend this!! We ate fresh croissants from the bakery across the street most mornings and a bottle of wine at night while enjoying the view from the balcony. This is the kind of hotel that has a romance and charm you will not find in larger chain hotels. I traveled to New Orleans recently for business and had to stay in a large chain hotel, even with all the amenities it could not compare to the Hotel Villa Convento.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, good location, older hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WildRabbits
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying there. The rooms were clean, just older. The free parking is great, you just probably don't want to go get your car from the parking garage after dark. It is outside the main quarter area. The hotel is a little hard to get to due to some of the crazy one way streets. Your GPS may lead you wrong, so you need to look at the printed map. It is easy walking distance from Jimmy Buffett's restaurant and the French Market. The wireless worked good. The staff was very nice. I stayed on this occasion with my brother and an earlier occasion with my wife. My wife thought it was a little rundown, but it was ok with me.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: boyglitter
Reviews.Content: Villa Convento was cozy and fitting for the French Quarter. You can feel its age with the first few steps inside. The staff was welcoming, warm, and felt familiar. The bakery across the street is a godsend the streets outside are low traffic with the occasional clip-clop of the carriages. I will not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Charming”
Reviews.Author: jjfitz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (now fiance) and I stayed at HVC on our first trip together, and enjoyed every minute. The location was perfect - within walking distance to the French Quarter shops and bars, but just beyond earshot (and smell-shot!) of the late-night Bourbon Street ruckus. The room was a little snug, but suited our needs just fine. Comfortable beds, charming decor, hot shower and friendly staff. We also enjoyed the courtyard - a perfect spot for relaxing with a book or enjoying an evening drink.

Reviews.Title: “Single Mom able to Escape with Toddler in tow”
Reviews.Author: orphanprincess
Reviews.Content: Being a single mom on a budget I decided to break the rules and visit this beautiful city with little money and the inconvenience of my adorable terrible two-er. Villa Convento offered the most affordable rate as one of the French Quarter's most historically colorful original homes. On the shuttle ride from the airport to the hotel I watched everyone else get off at massive remodeled hotels on noisy bourbon street and other high traffic corners. I was among the last stops. As the bus turned the corner onto Ursuline Street the sounds of tourists instantly diminished and it was although I had just went through a time capsule. To my right was the Ursuline convent lined by picturesque historic homes with just enough wear to confirm their authenticity. The shuttle parked in front of Croissant D' Or (a favorite among locals for pastries other than beignets and coffee). Directly across the street was the Old Creole townhome with 25 rooms (Villa Convento). My point is- everything about this hotel including it's location is AUTHENTIC to the soul of New Orleans that entices most us wandering from less romanticized places. The courtyard was eerily tranquil other than birds chirping above the old water fountain chipped in several places. I was worried my son would be a nuisance to this place- not so. I wouldn't scare anyone away by suggesting this place has troubled ghosts or anything... but the place DEFINITELY has a spirit... or two about it; hard to describe. Whatever it was it had an unusually calming effect on both my son and I. I am someone that NEVER stays in my hotel room even for a minute when I go anywhere- and I have stayed at some really nice places. This place was unlike any others; exceptionally unique. I truly could have stayed in my room and in the courtyard the entire time and still felt like I had absorbed a substantial part of New Orleans' spirit. This place is a MUST try for anyone that is really into history and especially the more colorful history of the Vieux Carre. This place is also a "make possible" option for anyone who wants to have a memorable experience without spending loads of money. That said the staff here is PHENOMENAL. Loved every one of them. Warren, Erin, Casey... And one other girl who was also a total sweetheart (I feel bad forgetting her name) were all totally welcoming, knowledgeable, and honest. Very very impressive staff. In a nutshell if you want a place with all the bells and whistles of enormous commercial complexes and massive hotels- this place is NOT for you. If you want somewhere that tempts you to hold your ear to the wall with the suspicion that you'll hear whispers from the past- this place is PERFECT. If you want to escape to somewhere peaceful and quiet with the all the historical charms of New Orleans being unobstructed by drunk and/or frenzied tourists- this place is TOP NOTCH. I loved it and will be back again for sure. Miss it so bad I delayed writing this because I was in denial about being home. lol.

Reviews.Title: “Really Convenient Location and Charming Architecture”
Reviews.Author: RareReviewerFlorida
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 5 days here and found it easy to get around the city. The streetcar, the tour sites, all the Quarter, restaurants, shops, galleries, are all within 15 minute walk max. Family-owned and staff is helpful, courteous, and good people. If you want real NO lodging, this is the place at a reasonable $. No, it doesn't have all the amenities of the big hotels, but very adequate. Free on-street parking when available. Housekeeping every day. We felt safe. There are some maintenance issues for a 200 year old building, but you can find that in varying degrees everywhere. GO FOR IT!

Reviews.Title: “Definitiely worth it”
Reviews.Author: m0nkeygirl
Reviews.Content: The only thing to excellent about this hotel is that it was a bit musty when we first walked in. Stayed for a total of 3 nights and really enjoyed it. The hotel is about a 5min walk to bourbon st activities and 4-5 min walk to Decatur st and Jackson square. There's a courtyard which is really cute and has seating and plantlife. There's also a garage but it's kind of a strange system: you have to get a key form the receptionist, drive a few blocks to park in the garage and then walk back with the key. If you're leaving you need to get the key and then drop it off. Kind of strange but mostly not a big deal. the garage isn't that big and if you block someone you have to leave your key with the receptionist (unless you're like me and don't want to, in which case you're expected to move your car whenever someone needs to move in or out). Overall, this was definitely worth it and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Rough around the edges - no frills - overall lack of upkeep”
Reviews.Author: hasti722
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went down to New Orleans the week after Christmas to get away from the family a bit. Though I wouldn't recommend this time of year unless you like the cold. We bundled up out side to brave weather. But the inside of the hotel was no better. It was freezing throughout the halls. There are many doors leading to other areas and patios on each floor, and for some reason, no matter what time of day I passed it, they were slightly ajar. I don't understand why as it was around 30 degrees at night. The staff was nice and helpful - I should know because we had to ask them for new batteries to our remote, for shampoo and conditioner that was not in our room, and for a hairdryer because where ours once was, there was now a marked tear in the wall - where someone had stolen or removed a wall mounted hairdryer. The bathroom had a plastic shower curtain that was ripped. Fingerprints from guests past were all over walls, doors, near light switches - does no one wipe down the walls? The art work was also ripped or dented along with the wall paper. Water stains also marked the ceilings and walls, shoeprints and luggage scrapes scarred the interior of our room. A fresh coat of paint or new art from a flea market would have helped. The bed was bowed - like sleeping in a hammock - that definitely added to the poor sleep we got. It was so cold in the rooms, that we were provided with electrical heaters. But there was no comfortable medium. At night the air was so hot and dry your mouth, tongue, lips and nostrils dried up and in the mornings we had sore throats. The bathroom sink is in the bedroom and it would clog with in seconds of brushing your teeth or washing your face. IF you could tolerate all that - there was a smell of sewer that appeared every so often, and sounds of the wall crumbling when people upstairs would move. It was definitely an old establishment with need of upkeep.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: DallasTravelgirl34
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in the Frommers travel guide, and it sounded quaint. I like boutique hotels, but this one seemed as though the owners did not really pay attention to details or care too much about them. Our room had a dresser with missing knobs, a piece of the wall had loose wires hanging out as though the fire alarm or something was supposed to be there. I told them about the wall, and they didn't seem to care. They didn't come look at it or anything. Also, the walls are paper thin. We could hear every word of our neighbor's television (among other things). For the price of this hotel, we were expecting MUCH more. We originally had three nights booked here, and left after our first night because we were so dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Taste of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller56
Reviews.Content: Visitors will either love it or hate it. There is a charming rustic authenticity to the Hotel Villa Convento that gives a real taste of New Orleans. The location is great! Its very close to the Frenchman's Ave. music venues and to the Balcony Music Club. The staff were always helpful, friendly and efficient. The property is old and shows its age and that may put off some visitors. But the quiet street, the location, and the staff more than make up for the minor issues with condition. I stayed in Room 400, which is a suite with 2 balconies with great views of the French Quarter. As you can see from the photos, the main room is large, with a very nice bed. Yes, the carpet is a bit worn and the curtains could be replaced, but the the room was very comfortable and much larger than I expected. According to the front desk, other rooms vary in size. If you are looking for a large, depersonalized hi-tech business hotel, then this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a true New Orleans experience in the quiet part of the French Quarter, then you should really consider the Villa Convento.

Reviews.Title: “House of the Rising Decrepit”
Reviews.Author: MsMacyBTX
Reviews.Content: My partner and I celebrated our anniversary with four nights in NOLA. We selected Villa Convento because the building's unique old history and the great location, close to lower Decatur and the Marigny. While this original "House of the Rising Son" seems charming on the outside, it is in terrible disrepair, showing years of lack of maintenance and poor standards of cleanliness. We liked room 103 initially, tucked away in the back off the courtyard. It's said to be one of the most haunted rooms but we saw no evidence of anything unusual. Upon closer inspection, the scariness lay in the dust bunnies hanging off the brick walls and broken mirror, the stench of urine in the bathroom, stained towels, and flithy corners. The control knob was broken off the A/C, the smoke alarm was missing, and the shower head had no pressure, plus spurted water on the bathroom floor constantly and the tub drain was clogged. What else? Roaches, broken towel rods, mismatched light bulbs in the ceiling fans, musty smell in general, worn mattresses. The courtyard consisted of algae-stained, moldy tiles, broken planters, creaking filmsy staircases, crumbling brick, etc. I love the faded charm of NOLA in general and don't mind old hotels or a little dust - but this place has been shamefully neglected. The Ursuline nuns would turn over in their graves knowing the Convento has become so decrepit. You'll get cleaner rooms at better prices at the Hotel Provincial around the corner on Charters, at Le Richeleui down Chartres, or at the Hotel Chateau on Chartres at St. Philip. Provincial also has a rich old, haunted history and has always provided clean, maintained rooms and grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Good value near French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jwheels
Reviews.Content: This is one of many small quaint hotels in the French Quarter. The hotel is family run and the family members were very solicitous and helpful at all times. The hotel is 3 blocks from the French market and even better- close to Frenchman Street- Check out all the clubs on Frenchman Street- you will feel like a local if you do. We had a room off the courtyard on the first floor. Our room was spacious but a bit worn or the edges. This hotel has charm and is a very good value- It isn't for people who need fancy tiles or get upset if the shower/bath isn't 4 feet deep. If you want a nice place- with good AC- a nice courtyard and that is across the street from a pasty shop-you''ll like this place. Note if you could spend more but why bother. Note they have wifi in the lobby and the outdoor courtyard

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Heka_BR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, in a quiet street, close to everything. Front desk staff was helpfull, but the room we took was one in the backside, with wiew to the internal garden. The stair and the balcony were old, needing a urgent repair. They had blocked the end of the balcony with a table, so nobody would fall. The room was smelling and the bed not firm. I think the hotel need to do some repairs fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great 50th birthday and the Villa Convento was a major part of it!”
Reviews.Author: scojoruck
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New Orleans late one afternoon having lost 20 IQ points for being tourists in a new city. We were warmly greeted by Warren who helped us get acclimated. Our only snag of the trip came from a tour we had set up for the next day. They had let us know that there were booking problems. Warren came to our rescue. While we drank Hurricanes at Pat O'Briens, he set up a new tour for us for the next day which happened to be my 50th birthday and the reason for the trip. The hotel location was ideal. Equipped with Warren's trusty map, we were able to navigate unfamiliar terrain without incident. The hotel was perfect for us. We stayed in the economy room (which was actually the only room left open when we booked the trip) and it was all that we needed. I was afraid that economy meant cheap but we were pleasantly surprised. Great bed, clean bathroom and cold air conditioner. The atmosphere was charming and reminiscent of another time. We were there for only two nights and during that time, both Warren and April made us feel like we were their only guests even though the place was fully booked. Before we left, our names went on their waiting list for next year. The hotel and staff made our brief visit to New Orleans both memorable and special. Can't wait to do it again!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite New Orleans hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: cerelife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay here, and we were wowed!! This hotel is a beautiful little property on the quiet side of the Quarter. We stayed in a 2nd floor balcony room, and from the balcony you can see the French Market, which is about a block and a half down the street, so a very short walk to Cafe DuMonde, Coop's, Port of Call, Lafitte's Blacksmith bar and so much else. The room was small, but lovely - think shabby chic - and the private balcony was sublime. The room was very clean...so clean that I walked around in my bare feet a lot of the time - something I RARELY do anywhere but home. There are a lot of very nice places to stay in New Orleans, but what made this a stellar experience is the staff. Everyone we met there was super nice and helpful. We arrived around noon, and were told we could go on up to our room, since it was ready even though check-in time was much later! And on our last morning, as we headed out for breakfast, we stopped to ask the front desk if we could store our bags after the noon check-out time, since our flight didn't leave until later in the afternoon. They told us not to worry about it, that our room wasn't booked for that day, so we could could have a last walk around the Quarter and come back to our room to pick up our bags and freshen up!! She even made sure we had a United cab at the front door to pick us up on time.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back - again and again!”
Reviews.Author: pfoutzie
Reviews.Content: Once again, a great visit at the Villa Convento. If you want the pristine sameness of a chain hotel, this is NOT the place for you. But if you're willing to overlook some cosmetics in exchange for a great, family-owned and operated property that's in a great location, I can't recommend this place highly enough. The new reception area is gorgeous, and the courtyard improvements are great as well. Plus for room 401: a mini fridge; minus: the decrepit hair dryer (easily remedied with a stop @ Walgreen's!) Super location, close to French Market, Croissant d'Or (across street) has everything to satisfy your early a.m. appetite. And if you're a dog lover, you'll be in luck: look for April and Tamale, and/or Warren and Oyster - the most charming welcoming crew you could hope for. Thanks, Villa Convento, for another great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location; a little rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: racheloBoston
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel Villa Convento is the selling point. It is on a quiet side street in the French Quarter with lovely views and cute shops and bakeries nearby. The building is old and beautiful. The balcony room we stayed in was nice looking, but at closer glance it was a little worn around the edges. There isn't a whole lot of insulation from the noise of the next room over and so we heard their whole morning routine, which was annoying because we wanted to continue sleeping. A totally pleasant stay for a few nights, but for the price I think they could afford to touch up some of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return...”
Reviews.Author: MelissasTrips
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at the Hotel Villa Convento and had a wonderful stay. My original reservation was for a loft room, but I received a call the night before that they had been making some renovations to that room and it wasn't going to be ready when I arrived, so they offered me 2 rooms for the same price. We already had a 2nd room reserved, and it seemed silly to take 3 rooms when there were only 4 of us staying, so we traded our 3 rooms, for 2 rooms with 2 beds in each... and it ended up cheaper for us... that's always a good thing. Our rooms were clean and comfortable and the location of the hotel is great. Within walking distance of everything we wanted to do. It is a very old building, and does need some repairs, but we were very pleased with our stay and have already made plans to return. Something I've never done in New Orleans is stay in the same place twice... now I've finally found a place I want to go back to. Our rooms each had 2 beds... 1 Queen and 1 Twin. No balcony, but we didn't need one, we were only there to sleep and shower... They both had air conditioning and a ceiling fan. 1 room had a jacuzzi tub. The hotel offers parking 5 blocks away, but we were lucky and got a spot on the street right out front.

Reviews.Title: “worried”
Reviews.Author: shaylaanderson
Reviews.Content: Mice, mold, and a terrible fire hazard. I had 3 light bulbs explode on me in just one week. Outlets hanging out of the wall. They should tear it down. Send the fire dept there and i'd imagine it would get shut down. WHOA.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: letoureiffel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villa Convento with a friend for three nights, and we couldn't have been happier there. Our balcony room was small, but nice, and it was very clean. I'm amazed by the complaints from other guests. If you're looking for the Four Seasons, go there. This is a small, family-run hotel with more charm than all the four star hotels in NOLA combined. AND, unlike 99% of the hotels in New Orleans, this one offers free garage parking. It's a few blocks away, and you have to get (and return) a key in order to access it, but it's not a big hassle. It gave us great peace of mind to know the car was safe. We also loved the location, just a couple of blocks away from the French Market and right in the heart of the French Quarter. We walked everywhere. This place is safe, quiet, and more reasonably priced than most other places we considered staying. I'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite spot”
Reviews.Author: blueswife
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have stayed at the Hotel Villa Convento every spring since 1983, always in March and often returning in April.I make my reservations a year in advance to be sure of getting in. I have watched the Campo family develop and maintain this charming place through a number of struggles, not the least of which was Katrina. They fight a constant battle against problems common to New Orleans, including the humidity and the post-Katrina lack of help . I have never felt unsafe there. It may ot be your 'cup of tea' if the Hilton is more your style. I like the personal touch the Campos put on the place. I find it very comfortable, and I know I'm welcome there. As the years have progressed, so has my disabling arthritis, and the hotel has made it easy for me to cope, constructing a ramp so my scooter can be stored in the laundry room. I look forward to returning for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Added to the charm of New Orleans...”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynGirlNewYork
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to New Orleans, and I have to admit that the Villa Convento just added to my experience! My friends and I were able to walk just about everywhere from the hotel - the location is great! The owners were friendly, the bed was comfortable, and the room was clean. One of my friends had a room with a balcony overlooking the street, and it was a real pleasure one evening while we shared a bottle of wine and heard the clop,clop of the horse-drawn carts pulling tourists around on ghost tours of the neighborhood, and saw the masts of boats sailing down the Mississippi just a few blocks away in the distance. I was just there two nights, but would recommend it to friends and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Mice, Mold, No Heat, Lots of Smoking!”
Reviews.Author: OrenWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: We chose the Villa Convento for it's location (walking distance to attractions, but far enough away to be on a quiet street). We were first time visitors. New Orleans was just rated with one of the highest crime rates in the USA, yet the Villa Convento is wide open to anyone who walks in off the street. The front door is open, and desk clerk is usually in the back, so anyone can wander in. Rooms have mold and mouse/rat infestation, throughout the entire property. Maids do not come in everyday, so you have to take your own trash out. They falsely advertise a free continental breakfast (rolls and pastery), but all they give you is free coffee or tea in the lobby. There were days when we didn't even get coffee: Were told they were out of coffee because the owner "forgot to buy it." There was building debris of some kind piled up by a wall in the hall when we arrived, and days later, it was still there. There was no heat in our room, unless we used the space heater, which was a fire hazard. The place was a badly organized, badly maintained, filthy mess, had no heat, an elevator at the end of the hall that woke us up with banging and groaning every time it was in use. And with all that lack of service, lack of security, lack of cleanliness, and presence of toxic mold, aswell as rats and mice, they have the nerve to say "No Pets and No Smoking" in guest rooms? Are they KIDDING?! Smoking is the only way one can block out the stink of the ratty old sticky wall to wall carpeting, and moldy walls! With all the rodents they have at the Villa Convento, I would imagine they would welcome people who want to bring their pet snakes for a free meal! If you MUST stay there, be sure to look inside your luggage when you are packing to leave, and be sure you are not taking any rodents home with you by accident. They tend to nestle into warm places, like packed suitcases, because the rooms are so freezing cold. If this hotel was in Washington, it would probably be closed down by the Health Department.

Reviews.Title: “Not great at the Hotel Villa Convento”
Reviews.Author: Cooper567
Reviews.Content: It was quiet, but the interior is rough around the edges, and they did not have maid service and room trash removal daily. Over all, the property could use a paint job, new carpets, and we had rodent infestation in our top floor room. They advertised free continental breakfast, but when we were there, they only served coffee and tea, and instructed us to buy our own rolls from the bakery across the street. They lock the door late at night, but the security is otherwise lax, because when the front door is open, there is often no one at the front desk, and there is no security guard, so anyone can walk in and have access to hallways and rooms. The location is good, because it is very quiet, but close to the restaurants and attractions. But this hotel needs work.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Leo35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Villa Convento for 2 nights in April 2007. The location of this place is right in the middle of the French Quarter, within walking distance to basically everything. This hotel has no private parking, and there is a 10 minute parking spot for people to unload their luggage. We were unfortunate enough not to be able to park in the 10 minute loading zone due to several people being parked there for an extended time.
