This made unloading and loading the car difficult since it is a one-way street and people would not wait for us to get our luggage (lots of honking and ugly looks). Other than the parking problem (which is quite common in the French Quarter), check-in and check-out was a breeze. The staff was very friendly and helfpul. There is a parking garage located about 4 or 5 blocks away (hotel staff will direct you to it), and the walk is easy as long as you don't have luggage with you. Our room was number 207. It wasn't very big, but who plans to stay in their hotel room while in New Orleans? The room itself was clean, but had a funny odor to it. The ceiling had some major stains, but overall things were fine. Bourbon Street is 2 blocks away, as well as the French Market. There are plenty of places to eat in the area, and shopping is good as well (I would suggest Royal Street). New Orleans is a changed place of course, and could really use a face-life (as well as this hotel). I spoke with other tourists during our stay, and they all agreed that most hotels in the area (even the very expensive ones) need a major overhauling these days. Things at the Villa Convento were going smoothly until it was time for us to pack up our luggage and check out. Then, I spotted it. The biggest cockroach I've ever seen! We are talking 3 inches long! It was crawling up the brick wall in our room! There was another one under the night stand as well that peeked its head out at about the same time. I guess they waited for us to pack up to say goodbye. I realize that N.O. has survived a major catastrophe, so the bug problem is to be expected. It just took me off guard I guess. Needless to say, this is the last impression of our stay at the Villa Convento. The overall stay was fine, but watch out for giant bugs!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastGreengirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Convento for a week in March 2007 and like many of the previous reviewers, found problems at this hotel. The staff is very friendly, the location is great, but quite frankly, the hotel was not very clean. The entry way is very run down and the carpets don't look like they have been cleaned in years. Plaster is falling off of the walls, the chairs in the entry are threadbare, and there are water stains on the ceiling and walls. Some of the problems can be attributed to Katrina, but many can not. The carpets were not vacumed the entire time we were there, with the same pieces of lint and small debris never removed. A close look at our room revealed dust that had turned into dirt on the top of shelves, picture frames and electrical cords. The bathroom walls had splatter spots that could have been easily washed off, along with simple things like washing light switches overlooked. Also, while the location of the hotel in the lower French Quarter is very quiet, we could clearly hear the conversations and TV from the room next to us. One day, when we returned from our activities, the room had not been cleaned and when I mentioned to the management that the maid had missed our room, was told that we wouldn't have maid service the next day either because the maid had gone to Houston! I think some of the staffing problems can be attributed to the shortage of labor because of Katrina, but, in general, I got the impression that the owners were just letting the place get rundown out of apathy or because they know people will continue to book there because of the location. The furniture on the balcony was rusted and broke when I was sitting on it, the plants shown in the pictures of the hotel are gone and the advertized continental breakfast is no more. I would warn anyone who makes a reservation here not to expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favorite”
Reviews.Author: sk0lat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Villa Convento many times over the past 20 years. This was our first visit since Katrina and I was happy to see not too much has changed. The Campo family has a jewel in the French Quarter and I thank them for that. We even got lucky enough to go grab coffee and croussiants and have them on our balcony in February (a treat to be outside this time of year when you are from Michigan). Things in NO on a whole seemed a little quiet, but if the tourists get back, I believe it will be ok. We will go back again and again, and my first choice will be to stay at the Villa Convento.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: jjmarkp
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. This is not the fanciest of hotels (a previous reviewers "shabby chic" comment certainly applies). But, it is one I would stay at again without hesitation. The location is great (close to Decatur and the French Market). It was cozy (esp. considering the weather was cold while I was there), clean, and comfortable. My room was large and nicely furnished. The owners were very helpful, especially with dining recommendations. Every place they recommended was good. Nice job Hotel Villa Convento!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Chic”
Reviews.Author: deltaskye
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Villa Convento for over 20 years, but this was my first trip after Katrina. It should be stated up front that if you are looking for a pristine, perfect hotel with full modern amenities, skip the Villa Convento. The hotel is showing its age, and my guess is that the owners are budgeting closely while the city and its tourism industry recover from the hurricanes. The carpet is worn, there is some peeling wallpaper and chipped paint, but for me these cosmetic flaws are mitigated by the old building's charm, its great location, and the friendly Campo family. I stayed several nights in 302, which I like because it's on top (no annoying footsteps overhead), has a balcony, and is away from the noisy elevator. I love the exposed worn brick and, while smaller than some hotel rooms, the room was roomy for me. It was spotless, and they've added hair dryers, irons, and ironing boards since my last stay. I like having the sink/vanity separate from the bathroom. There was a ceiling fan plus AC unit, which one needs in late October. There's also satellite TV. I grabbed newspapers from the street each morning and read them on the balcony as local folks washed off their stoops and swept their sidewalks below me. The Campos are always full of tourist tips, and I enjoyed meeting the newest family member, Oyster, a Lab they rescued from an oyster bed who hangs out behind the registration desk. Try the funky Clover Grill diner on 900 Royal for 24-hour-breakfast. There's also a full A&P grocery on Royal, and a Walgreen's near the Jax Brewery mall on the river. If you have a car, be aware that there is zoned parking everywhere in the Quarter, meaning many spaces are limited to two hours if you are not a resident. Also, construction vehicles take up a lot of parking space. I always find paid parking in lots on the edges of the Quarter, some of which use the honor system for payment. Oh, and don't be afraid when the tiny hotel elevator lurches and bumps on its way down -- it's been doing that for 20 years!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Hotel Villa Convento”
Reviews.Author: porcupine150
Reviews.Content: Please see the pictures posted with this review. The Hotel Villa Convento is run by the Campo family and is a small hotel in the French Quarter located 2 blocks from the French Market at Ursalines St. and Chartres St. The public areas are small but very nice. I was able to check in at 1 PM to a good sized room with 2 queen beds. The room was very clean with brand new carpet. Our room faced the courtyard that was filled with beautiful plants. Coffee was provided every morning and housekeeping cleaned the room every day. The Campos are very friendly and it almost feels like a bed and breakfast. A wonderful pastry shop is right across the street called Croissant Dâ€™Or. You can get croissants filled with ham, cheese or sausage . I highly recommend the Hotel Villa Convento for the very reasonable rates, great location and friendly staff. The hotel is less than a block from the Ursalines Convent Museum and the Beauregard-Keyes Museum. It is an easy 5 block walk down Chartres St. to the Frenchmen St. music clubs. This is a quiet safe part of the FQ but very close to Jackson Square and the mayhem of Bourbon St. They offer offsite parking for $12 per day in their garage 5 blocks away at Decatur St. and Frenchmen St.

Reviews.Title: “I love the VIlla”
Reviews.Author: suzQ2006
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Villa the past 3 out of 4 Jazz Fest's. The one time I stayed somewhere else I missed it terribly. It is a wonderful hotel, with lots of history and character. This family run establishment is helpful with guest concerns and willing to fo above and beyond. The crouissants are to die for as well. The courtyard breakfast with a cup of really good coffee is a great way to start your day after a night of music before. I will always stay at the Villa when I am in NOLA from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Feel of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: My wife had to go to a conference last May in New Orleans for two days. We decided to make a long weekend out of it so I flew down after. She had stayed at the Astor, then checked out and we met at the Villa Convento for 3 nights. I have to admit that I loved it. it was suggested to us by a friend. I think that if you go to the French Quarter and want the whole experience then staying in a chain hotel is a waste. You can stay at a chain in any town in America. Hotels such as the Villa give you the perfect ambiance and feel of the quarter. The building has a lot of history. Our room was clean, there were areas where they could stand to repair but we felt it was cozy and a fun place to stay. We stayed in Room 300 which was a full bed with a balcony view looking over Ursulines Street. The street is very quiet and a quick walk to Bourbon. PLUS right across the street is Croissant d'Ors. This has to be the best bakery and coffee shop in the quarter. You can run across the quiet street, grab breakfast to go and be on your private iron balcony within 5 minutes. We are coming back again in late May & early June for 5 days and staying here again, this time in room 302 which is a queen bed. On the 3rd floor, rooms 300-302 are all balcony rooms with a view of the street and the convent. They have a pretty good website that shows you photos and room layouts of all their rooms. Check it out and check in if you are looking for an authentic New Orleans experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Villa Convento has Potential.”
Reviews.Author: NCNM1976
Reviews.Content: For the price in the French Quarter in New Orleans, you can't beat Hotel Villa Convento. However be advised that there are problems with the hotel: the hotel in general (lobby, courtyard, stairwell,...) is very run down. Our room seemed to be charming BUT we were very dismayed to find bed bugs laying on our bed all 4 nights of our stay there. Good points: FRIENDLY staff, location (safe neighborhood), bathroom was newly renovated. All in all, if you have a family, spend the extra money to stay at a nice hotel. All others...be aware what I detailed above.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: mellow_goat
Reviews.Content: I went here near Christmas. Before I discuss the hotel I would like to tell a little but about me. I go to the quarter often. I have stayed at half of the hotels in the quarter. They have a charm all their own. Most of them are not in the best condition but are beautiful because of the history and architecture they contain. I will stay at any one these before I would stay at a big soulless chain. The Villa Convento has a wonderful location. It is next to the best pastry shop I have ever eaten at. The chocolate croissant is unbelievable. I make sure I eat at the Croissant Dâ€™or every morning while I am in New Orleans. The French Market can be seen from the hotel. The location is also very quiet. The parking makes you feel like you car is very safe. The staff is sweet and blithely delightful. Now the hotel itself leaves some to be desired. The room was dirty. Not a little dirty, filthy. The bathroom had a dirty hand towel on the floor, toothpaste and spit on the mirror. The hotel was short-handed due to the hurricane but should still be cleaned between guests. A mold was growing on the ceiling line of the room. The brick walls always stayed damp causing this problem. Every time you touch the wall you would get a brick power on your clothing. When you have a wall of this age one should seal it. This would get rid of the mold and the brick dust. The bed was against the wall. So, when you would sleep brick dust would get into your eyes and face. Again, if the walls were sealed this would not be a problem. If this hotel does some renovations I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “hotel villa convento has charm”
Reviews.Author: jlr51
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed at the Villa Convento in October, 2005, shortly after New Orleans was reopened to visitors. We have stayed at the Villa Convento several times and I will agree that it is somewhat run-down and needs sprucing up. However, we have always found the staff to be very accommodating, in fact, it is the friendliness of the staff that makes us return. On two different occasions, we have had staff members visit with us for over an hour, just being sociable. When we visited shortly after Katrina, we found everything to be in order as much as possible under the circumstances. Our bathroom was spotlessly clean (always has been every time we have stayed there). The room was clean enough - by that I mean that our bedding was clean and the carpet was clean. If you looked in the corners you would probably see some dust. However, we had a wonderful balcony so I wasn't going to complain about a little bit of dust in the corners. Two years ago my husband and I arrived in the French Quarter on Halloween Day, a very busy day for the Quarter. We were having a terrible time trying to get a room. We stopped at Villa Convento and they did not have any rooms in their hotel, but they also manage a property across the street, and they had a room available for $39! That price would make me suspicious anywhere, and unheard of in the Quarter. We asked to see the room first, and found it to be a very clean, nice room. In fact, the bathroom fixtures appeared to be brand new. That $39 room in the French Quarter was probably the best travel bargain that we ever got - and in addition to that, we also got to spend an hour or so chatting with the delightful Ms. Campo, who is in her 80's, but prior to Katrina continued to work at the Villa Convento. The Villa Convento is a quaint family-owned and operated guesthouse. It is not a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villa Convento in Dec 2005, after the Deluge. Eventhough I was expecting some inconveniences due to the condition of the rest of New Orleans, at the Villa Convento all was well and good. The service at the front desk was exemplary - friendly and professional. The room was charmingly shabby chic, but clean and cozy. I slept very well in the comfortable bed and quiet room. I would stay there again in a heart beat - except for the parking. The parking fee is very reasonable because the parking garage is a few blocks away from the hotel. I was alone and had difficulty in finding a place to park whenever I had to get or return the parking garage key. If I had been with another person who could jump out and do the key thing while I waited in the car, it wouldn't have been a problem. I felt reasonably safe walking to and from the garage, but it wasn't the ideal situation for a female walking alone. Otherwise, the Villa Convento was a highlight of my stay in New Orleans, and I recommend it as an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Will return again and again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Villa Convento a number of times in the last 10+ years. The rooms are always clean, the staff is always friendly (and they remember us, even when we phone for reservations), and the hotel is always quiet at all hours. The furnishings, linens and bathrooms have improved over the years. And the price is definitely right, and for us the location is perfect--not too near the noisy areas, but close enough to quickly walk to any of our favorite shops, bars and restaurants--and the pastry shop across the street is heaven. Although the elevator does need work and the courtyard could be improved, we love the place, and will never stay anywhere else in N.O. if we have a choice. Best of luck to the Campo family during their recovery from the Hurrican Katrina disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quaint hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful 5 night stay at the Villa Convento hotel. When the cab pulled up to the hotel we thought "uh-oh". Definetely does not look like the usual cookie-cutter 4/5 star hotel we're used to staying in. No chandeliers in the lobby, or uniformed bell hops to help with luggage. Couple this with the elevator ride and we really were wondering if we made the right choice in hotels. However, as soon as we opened the door to our room (302) we immediately changed our minds. Clean tile floor in the entrance and bathroom. Extremely clean and comfortable room with a balcony that overlooked the corner of Chartres and Ursuline. Great for people watching and hanging out and relaxing. The room next to us was being remodeled while we were there but we heard no noise at all. Yes, the elevator is small and could definitely stand to be re-upholstered or, better yet, paneled. The courtyard could be so much nicer if it was cleaned up a little. And, for the price, they could replenish the soap daily and provide complimentary shampoo. However, realizing that it's a family-owned and operated hotel, these were very minor complaints. In closing, we would definetely reccomend the Villa Convento to anyone wishing to stay in the French Quarter. We'll surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: SGRIERSON
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Suite and had a great view of downtown from our balcony. The family that owns the hotel is very nice. The elevator is unique but could stand to be reupholstered. The location was great, close to the action but not noisy. It was pricey for the level of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: Libertinequeen
Reviews.Content: What can I say? The three of us were advised to go to this hotel after having so much trouble trying to find accomodation in a suitable location, we found out there was a conference in NO the beginning of the week. We had four nights there and had to swap rooms after two nights for a slightly smaller room (we knew this before we booked). If I'm honest after reading some of the reviews I wasn't sure what to expect, we were all very pleasantly surprised the rooms were lovely very homely, nice and clean and all the staff were very friendly no matter what time or what we asked. Can definitley recommend, for what we paid for we got above our expectations. Cannot understand at all why people still complain about a place this nice and this reasonably priced?

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay here for our first trip to New Orleans in November. The location, price and ambiance were great but I could not help feeling that with a little effort it could have been so much better. The staff was amazing from the time we booked reservations to the end of our stay and the location was everything we could have asked for. I think the balcony was what made our room. We ended up spending every night on it talking while watching people walk by. The elevator was a bit run down but was very European and I kind of liked it's antique charm. The hotel in general could use a little renovation though. Our room seemed continually humid (yes I know this is just part of NO), but we could not get our AC working right. On a few occasions we were kept up by the sound of other people in their rooms. Like a previous person mentioned the plant on our balcony was dead and the pot filled with cigarette butts. If you are willing to overlook a few of these things for the location and quaintness then go for it. If these are the things that really bug you I would find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, however, our room was filthy!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine_K_SA
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews of the Hotel Villa Convento, I looked forward to our stay with much anticipation. The location was great and the price was right, so what could be so wrong? Our room was filthy! The floor in the sink area had a thick accumulation of dust and hair in the corners and the white light fixture over the sink was so caked with dust and dirt, the color was dark gray. In addition, the walls were filthy and stained, badly in need of a fresh coat of paint. Finally, to top it all off, the stench of stale cigarettes was so overwhelming, I got sick to my stomach. (Did I mention the flower pot FULL of cigarette butts just outside our door???) Our bedspread had several rips, as well, and the lamp shades were also caked with dust. I could go on... When I politely pointed this all out to the gal at the front desk, she said I would have to speak with the manager about the light fixture. What??? I tactfully mentioned the only thing needed was a wet rag treatment by the cleaning staff. She acted like I was asking for something unreasonable! So, when the light fixture was still filthy after they "cleaned" the room, I took one of their towels and cleaned it myself. (It only took ten second!) The bottom line is there appeared to be no pride of ownership. The common areas were dirty, too, so perhaps this hotel has gone down hill since the previous reviews were written. Advice: If you have dust allergies like I do, don't stay at this hotel; especially in room 105. Everything was dusty: the floor, lights, baseboards, lamps and lampshades, ETC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hote, Great price! I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: tooltimeterry
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when my wife and I decided to go to NO on the spur of the moment. We had no resevvations and as we got there found that there were several conventions. Almost every where we tried was booked. We had a list of numbers from the LA welcome station that we started calling. We got a great "walk-in" rate for a Saturday night of $59. It was an older smaller hotel that had a real New Orleans "flavor". I found it clean with a comfortable bed, helpful staff, good parking and a great location central to everything. I go to NO regularly and stay at a varity of hotels. I will definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a quaint inn that is so convenient to the French Quarter yet far enough away. This place has a great staff and is very clean and right across from the town's best coffee and croissants!

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying with a Friend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found the Hotel Villa Convento through this website. From the moment we called to make our reservations, we were treated extremely well by the Campo family. The whole experience was exactly what we expected and more. The room looked exactly as the pictures on the website. It had a very uncomplicated layout and was exactly what we needed. The elevator may be small to some, but we found it to be a perfect fit to the entire hotel. This was the first time we stayed in the quarter (an area filled with a rich history) and we found the hotel to be very quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of other parts of the french quarter. We could not hear the other guests staying on either side of us and we got a great night's rest every night. The balcony was my husband's favorite part. One night he even said it was like staying over at a friend's house.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: gerrysc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day stay and would definitely not recommned this place. Our room was dirty, the paint peeling and tiles were missing in the moldy bathroom. You have to stand on a chair to adjust the rattling air conditioner. The breakfast had so-so rolls with weak coffee. The pictures on their web site and brochure are nothing like the place. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 'V' was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Labor Day weekend, 2004, and I found the Hotel "V" was a great hotel for the money. It was within walking distance of everything of interest. Tucked away on one of the less busy streets, it was a great retreat when I wanted to "escape the madness and fun" of Bourbon Street. While the outside could stand a little attention (i.e paintwork) the room was very nice; I just considered this little "flaw" part of the ambiance. After all, I didn't go to New Orleans to stay in a hotel room! If you go in knowing you're not staying at the Ritz, but an original old New Orleans brothel, you'll enjoy the stay. If you're wanting your sheets turned down and mints placed on your pillows, you'll need to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Villa Convento from 5-6-04 to 5-10-04. It was close to everything, but was situated in a quite part of the French Quarter. Our room was very nice, and the staff was great. We would definitely stay there again. The prices were great also.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location - Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: DebbaJoy
Reviews.Content: What a great little family owned and operated hotel. You get a feel of old New Orleans at a great price and fabulous location. Our room was on the second floor, and yes - the elevator was small but sooo cool. The walls of the elevator are done in tapestry! It is no smaller than the "lifts" in Europe. Just lends to the charm of the place. Our room was small, but clean and the bed was comfortable. We had a balcony where we sat eating muffalattas from the deli down the street one afternoon. It's so close to everything. We didn't have a car and didn't need one. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I'd stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The price and location are great! I had no problem with my reservation, but others I was with had room mix-ups. Double check your reservation. I recommend a balcony room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, safe area”
Reviews.Author: DaisyMcCoy
Reviews.Content: A nice, basic, small hotel, owned by a very nice family. No frills. Shabby and a bit run down, but clean. Helpful staff. Good mattresses. Adequate bathrooms. Good room prices. The courtyard could be an absolute gem if they would fix the rotting porch and get rid of the dead plants. Our room had a balcony where we had coffee each morning. The hotel's best feature is that it is in a safe and convenient area, just three blocks from St. Louis Cathedral. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Villa Convento”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two friends of mine and I stayed at this very charming B&B in August. We stayed in one of the top floor suites...with a nice large balcony! Great for people watching or just relaxing with a drink in hand and watching the storms roll in over the city. We could see all over town, as well as the river. It was fun to see and hear the large river and cruise boats floating by! The elevator is a bit scary and slow, but once you get used to it, and realize its a great peice of historical architechture, you dont mind it so much! Their breakfast consists of pastries and yummies from the delicious cafe across the street. The room was nice and spacious, with a living room and a wonderful JET tub! Those bubbles are amazingly invigorating. The hotel is going under major renovations, but its looking good! Also, when we first arrived we had no water for about 30 minutes...but other than that we had a perfect stay. I would definitely return.
